vaqpack

Class VP_GUIController

  • java.lang.Object
    • vaqpack.VP_GUIController

  • public class VP_GUIController
extends java.lang.Object
    Events triggered by or altering the VaqPak GUI. This class links the GUI to the data and to user events, and provides a centralized location where components can reference each other.
    Since:
    1.0

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      protected class  VP_GUIController.ClosingSequence
      Prevents the window from closing before the user saves things.
      class  VP_GUIController.VPErrorAlert
      Custom-styled JavaFX Alert for errors.

    • Constructor Detail

      • VP_GUIController

        protected VP_GUIController(javafx.stage.Stage primaryStage)
        Constructor. Creates the empty scene and sets the TITLE for it. Creates a VP_Loader and sets it as visible, while the empty GUI is not visible.
        Parameters:
        primaryStage - Sent to header object for full-screen control.
        Since:
        1.0

    • Method Detail

      • errorAlert

        public void errorAlert(int errorCode,
                       java.lang.String exceptionString)
        Loads an error into a new VP_ErrorHandler and then shows an alert with the header and content determined by VP_ErrorHandler.
        Parameters:
        errorCode - Sent to VP_ErrorHandler to determine the message.
        exceptionString - The exception converted to string, if the error happens to call an exception. Can be an empty string.
        Since:
        1.0

      • logoutUser

        protected void logoutUser()
        Series of actions that must occur when a user logs out. Stops the timer that logs users out for inactivity. Calls logout() for the user to clear bound values and then calls newUserSet() which will detect that there is no user and will adjust the GUI accordingly. Finally, this function calls updateTree() to make the tree invisible.
        Since:
        1.0

      • updateTree

        protected void updateTree(int fromPage)
        Must be called whenever the user has logged in, has successfully completed a major task, or has logged out. This functions determines which branches of the tree are visible. Calls updateDynamicTree which will either create or delete leaves of the tree depending on the addition or deletion of particular entries by the user.
        Parameters:
        fromPage - From which page of the wizard this function has been called. In the case where all tree branches should be checked, fromPage should be 0.
        Since:
        1.0

      • newUserSet

        public void newUserSet()
        Makes changes throughout the GUI, triggered when the current user has changed. If the user is logged in, the inactivity timer is set.
        Since:
        1.0
